intro: Fleischmannia hassleri, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers and climbing growth habit. The plant produces showy, violet to purple blooms that open in the early morning and close by midday. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and twining. Fleischmannia hassleri is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots and a capacity to store water efficiently.
